tool_description: The Certified Translation API can be used to create translations of complex documents by professionally certified human translators.
name: Certified Translation
title: Certified Translation

api_list.name: Get Account
api_list.description:
Retrieves information about the current account, including:

- Users
- Stored Payment Methods
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://certified-translation.p.rapidapi.com/account"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "certified-translation.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://certified-translation.p.rapidapi.com/account"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "certified-translation.p.rapidapi.com"

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Retrieve Order
api_list.description: Retrieves a specific order by the order number.

required_parameters.name: order_number
required_parameters.description: A unique number identifying the order.

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://certified-translation.p.rapidapi.com/orders/123456-123456"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "certified-translation.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://certified-translation.p.rapidapi.com/orders/{order_number}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "certified-translation.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: List Orders
api_list.description:
Retrieves a paginated list (default `50`) of orders associated with the provided account, sorted in descending order by `created_at`.

The `Order` objects included in this response are reference objects, meaning they do not contain all the possible properties of the order, but rather a glimpse.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://certified-translation.p.rapidapi.com/orders"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "certified-translation.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Languages
api_list.description: Retrieves a list of available languages and their respective ISO codes.
